Yes, I totally agree! I was trying to make it easier via points, but I would prefer deliberation.

FireFaced is absolutely correct here. I feel as if I should elaborate a little:

Last year, I really didn't have the time to coordinate something massive like this, but I did it anyway. This year, there will probably be more entries and less free time for me to judge them. Instead of driving myself insane with this or having the results delayed by a long, long time, I decided to hand off the proverbial baton instead.

So, it would be nice if someone else kept this going. I would love [@KasperVld](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/40700-kaspervld/) to be the "manager" of the Oscar-B's: it would lend a real air of professionalism and it would increase the likelihood of being seen by others. I can completely understand if Kasper's unwilling or unable to do it, though; I also think [@HatBat](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/89536-hatbat/) or [@Felbourn](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/97344-felbourn/) would do a top-notch job.

~~~

So, thoughts? ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

-Upsilon

Wow, it's crazy how time flies. That reminds me I've only got until April to finish my film...  yeah, as much as I'd love to, I think it's for the best that I don't have a very active role in organising/judging. I'm in it to win it this year. I think the best course of action would be to have it hosted by [@KasperVld](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/40700-kaspervld/) / [@Felbourn](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/97344-felbourn/) this year. Though as you might have guessed by how vocal I was regarding the judging process: I'd appreciate some sort of advisory position.

Things do indeed change quite a bit in a year. I'm busier than last time. Project Alexandria takes a long time to produce one episode now, and it's my only real series. Last time I had shows that were easier to make, thus leaving me extra time to contribute here. I'll consider hosting, but I can't guarantee it. I agree the ideal case would be to get additional officialization(TM) of the awards. That would make it worth the additional time investment.

Oh cool, I'm glad to see this is coming back. I can't believe it's been a year already!
